name: Izanagi-no-Mikoto
subtitle: The Male Who Invites - Progenitor of the Gods

narrative.content: After creating the land, Izanagi and Izanami gave birth to numerous kami governing all aspects of the world - gods of sea, wind, trees, mountains, rivers, and plains. Their creative union produced the divine framework of nature itself. However, when Izanami gave birth to Kagutsuchi, the fire god, his flames burned her. Despite Izanagi's grief and care, she died from her injuries - the first death among the kami. In his rage and sorrow, Izanagi beheaded Kagutsuchi with his sword Totsuka, and from the fire god's blood and body sprang yet more kami, including thunder gods and mountain deities.

Polluted by his contact with death and the underworld, Izanagi traveled to the river mouth of Tachibana in Himuka (modern Miyazaki Prefecture) to purify himself. As he stripped off his garments and ornaments, various kami were born from each item. As he washed in the water, deities of pollution and purification arose. Finally, washing his face produced the three most noble kami: Amaterasu from his left eye, Tsukuyomi from his right eye, and Susanoo from his nose. This misogi ritual established the fundamental Shinto practice of purification through water.

mythology_stories.sources: Sources:Kojiki(Record of Ancient Matters, 712 CE),Nihon Shoki(Chronicles of Japan, 720 CE),Sendai Kuji Hongi,Kogo Shui

family.origins: • One of the first divine generations, created by or emerging from the primordial kami
family.consort: • Izanami-no-Mikoto - "She Who Invites," his divine sister-wife, now ruler of Yomi
family.children with izanami: • The islands of Japan, countless kami of nature, and finally Kagutsuchi (fire god) whose birth killed her
family.children from misogi: • Amaterasu (left eye), Tsukuyomi (right eye), Susanoo (nose) - the three noble children
family.children from garments: • Various kami born as he removed his clothes for purification

archetype.description: Izanagi embodies the Creator God archetype - the primordial masculine force that brings order from chaos and fathers the divine generations.
